intro: Turraeanthus africanus, commonly known as the African turraeanthus, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disc of tubular flowers. Turraeanthus africanus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
